H0.text: Dust, gas, and ice are the scientific classifications for galaxies in the universe.

H1.text: Small, medium, and large are scientific classifications for galaxies in the universe.

H2.text: Spiral, elliptical, and irregular are scientific classifications for galaxies in the universe.

H3.text: Red giant, white dwarf, and supernova are scientific classifications for galaxies in the universe.

A4.text: Spiral galaxies form a class of galaxy originally described by Edwin Hubble in his 1936 work The Realm of the Nebulae and, as such, form part of the Hubble sequence.

A5.text: Spiral galaxies are named by their spiral structures that extend from the center into the galactic disk.
